expression: strike while the iron is hot

selectionMeta.selectedPhrase: strike while the iron is hot

step1.sentence: You've just impressed the hiring manager, so send your follow-up email today and strike while the iron is hot.

step2.story: After the investor showed genuine interest in her startup, Mia knew she had to strike while the iron is hot. She stayed up all night refining her pitch deck and requested a formal meeting the next morning. Her boldness paid off — the deal was signed within a week.

step3.story: The real estate market in the city had been stagnant for years, but suddenly prices began to dip and buyers were scarce. David's colleague urged him to wait and see, but David remembered every time he'd hesitated and lost out. He called his broker that same afternoon, deciding to strike while the iron is hot. Within days he had put in an offer on a downtown apartment that had been out of reach for years. His friends thought he was reckless, but David trusted his instincts. Six months later, the market rebounded and his new property had already gained thirty percent in value.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 쇠가 뜨거울 때 두드려라 — 대장장이가 쇠를 달구었을 때 바로 망치질해야 원하는 형태로 만들 수 있다는 뜻이다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 기회가 찾아왔을 때 망설이지 않고 즉시 행동해야 한다는 의미로, 좋은 상황이나 유리한 조건이 유지되는 동안 빠르게 결정하거나 실행할 것을 권할 때 사용한다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 대장장이(blacksmith)가 쇠를 불에 달구어 붉게 달아올랐을 때 망치질해야 원하는 형태로 만들 수 있다는 데서 유래했으며, 16세기 영어 문헌에서부터 비유적 표현으로 쓰였다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 긍정적인 기회를 놓치지 말라는 격려의 뉘앙스가 강하며, 과도한 분석이나 지연을 경계하는 실용적·행동 지향적 조언으로 쓰인다. 압박감보다는 적극성을 촉구하는 느낌이다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: The client seemed ready to sign, so we struck while the iron was hot and closed the deal that afternoon.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 고객이 서명할 준비가 된 것 같았기 때문에 우리는 쇠뿔도 단김에 빼자는 마음으로 그날 오후 바로 계약을 성사시켰다.
